page.title: 07Village life - Then & Now
page.content: The village hall is the main centre of village organised activities.The retired population play bowls on the two recently restored greens.The Woman's Institute after a lapse of 12years have started to meet again.The youngsters of the village can go to the hall to play badmington and snooker. When we interviewed teenagers of the village they all agreed that they liked Temspford as a place but there was very little to do for their age range and the main problem for being able to get out and about was the lack of public transport.The village has a bus service to Bedford every two hours during the day but no late evening services.On local market days a service bus stops near Tempsford to go to Sandy and St.Neots.
